meanings.definition: The state of being temporarily inactive or suspended.
meanings.sent1: During the winter, the bear's hibernation is an abeyancies in its usual activity.
meanings.sent2: The abeyancies of the construction project caused a delay in the completion date.
meanings.sent3: The abeyancies of the sleepy cat made it miss its playtime.
meanings.sent4: The abeyancies of the storm left the town in a state of eerie stillness.
meanings.sent5: The abeyancies of the computer system made the office work come to a halt.

meanings.definition: The act of delaying or postponing something.
meanings.sent1: The student's constant abeyancies in submitting assignments frustrated the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The abeyancies in making a decision only prolonged the issue.
meanings.sent3: His abeyancies in paying the bill resulted in late fees.
meanings.sent4: The abeyancies in repairing the roof led to further damage during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The abeyancies in starting the project caused unnecessary stress later on.
